greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n mod 4 = 0 then a(n) = n/4, otherwise a(n) = n.
comment: Equivalent to A065883 for n mod 16 != 0. - _Peter Kagey_, Sep 02 2015
link: Jeremy Gardiner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,2,0,0,0,-1).
formula: a(n) for n > 0 is multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^e if e < 2 and a(2^e) = 2^(e-2) if e > 1 otherwise a(p^e) = p^e for prime p > 2 and e >= 0.
Dirichlet inverse b(n) is multiplicative with b(2^e) = (-1)^e * A038754(e), e >= 0, and for prime p > 2: b(p) = -p and b(p^e) = 0 if e > 1.
mathematica: Table[If[Mod[n, 4] == 0, n/4, n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 26 2017 *)
results.author: _Jeremy Gardiner_, Jul 15 2012
